meta.name: Differentially Private Support Vector Machines Demo
meta.description: A test from single shot regresssion

covariates.label: Covariates
covariates.description: Demographic or medical features (e.g., isControl, sex, age)

data.label: Measurements
data.description: Files containing brain region measurements (e.g., FreeSurfer files)

is_private_local.label: Is_private_local
is_private_local.description: Private or public version of model

perturb_method_local.label: Perturb_method_local
perturb_method_local.description: Perturbation method for conserving privacy: objective / output, not needed for public version

fit_intercept_local.label: Fit_intercept_local
fit_intercept_local.description: Whether to calculate the intercept for the local model. If set to false, intercept = 0 (i.e., local training data is already centered).

intercept_scaling_local.label: Intercept_scaling_local
intercept_scaling_local.description: When fit_intercept_local = true, sample vector x becomes [x, intercept_scaling], i.e., a “synthetic” feature is appended. The intercept (in y = w'x + intercept) becomes intercept_scaling * synthetic feature weight. Note the synthetic feature weight is subject to l2 regularization as all other features. To lessen the effect of regularization on synthetic feature weight (and therefore on the intercept) intercept_scaling has to be increased.

is_private_owner.label: Is_private_owner
is_private_owner.description: Private or public version of model

perturb_method_owner.label: Perturb_method_owner
perturb_method_owner.description: Perturbation method for conserving privacy: objective / output, not needed for public version

fit_intercept_owner.label: Fit_intercept_owner
fit_intercept_owner.description: Whether to calculate the intercept for the aggregator model. If set to false, intercept = 0 (i.e., soft predictions are expected to be already centered).

intercept_scaling_owner.label: Intercept_scaling_owner
intercept_scaling_owner.description: When fit_intercept_owner = true, soft prediction vector u becomes [u, intercept_scaling], i.e., a “synthetic” feature is appended. The intercept (in y = w'u + intercept) becomes intercept_scaling * synthetic feature weight. Note the synthetic feature weight is subject to l2 regularization as all other features. To lessen the effect of regularization on synthetic feature weight (and therefore on the intercept) intercept_scaling has to be increased.

train_split.label: Train Split
train_split.description: Percentage of data used for training at the owner site

shuffle.label: Shuffle
shuffle.description: Whether shuffle or not when splitting train / test dataset

cm_test_owner.label: Remote site: Confusion Matrix of the test data

cm_test_owner_normalized.label: Remote site: Normalized Confusion Matrix of the test data

cm_train_owner.label: Remote site: Confusion Matrix of the training data

cm_train_owner_normalized.label: Remote site: Normalized Confusion Matrix of the training data

cm_test_locals.label: Local sites: Confusion Matrix of the test data

cm_test_locals_normalized.label: Local sites: Normalized Confusion Matrix of the test data

cm_train_locals.label: Local sites: Confusion Matrix of the training data

cm_train_locals_normalized.label: Local sites: Normalized Confusion Matrix of the training data

n_samples_owner_train.label: Remote site: Number of training data samples

n_samples_owner_test.label: Remote site: Number of test data samples

n_samples_locals.label: Local sites: Number of data samples
